title: [Self-directed] Cognitive Load Theory-Based Collaborative and Problem-Based Learning Design for Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational nursing theories, practical experience, and principles of adult learning
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical competencies through smartphone-based learning activities and application of real nursing scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can design strategies to decompose complex nursing scenarios step-by-step by applying Cognitive Load Theory.
Learners propose methods to reduce the cognitive burden of patient symptom evaluation by 20% through knowledge sharing among team members in a collaborative learning environment.

Through problem-based learning (PBL), learners can select three nursing problems from real clinical scenarios (e.g., infection control, medication errors, emergency response) and develop a PBL protocol (problem definition → hypothesis setting → data collection → solution derivation → evaluation) that achieves over 80% satisfaction in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
